entries: The Ghost Ship lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Haunted Hull
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can manifest phantasmal fragments of the Ghost Ship on the battlefield, crewed by ethereal spirits with wispy skeletons and translucent flesh. You can use an action to manifest parts of the ship as one of the following effects. Once you manifest one of these effects, you can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Crow's Nest
entries: You manifest a single undead lookout, which hovers up to 120 feet directly above you for 1 minute. While you aren't {@condition deafened}, you know the location of every creature within 120 feet of you, including those that are hidden, {@condition invisible}, or on the Ethereal Plane.

entries.name: Possessed Rigging
entries: You manifest spectral ropes, which lash out at a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your warlock spell save DC or be {@condition restrained} by ropes for 1 minute. A {@condition restrained} creature can use its action to make a Strength check against your warlock spell save DC, freeing itself and destroying the ropes on a success.

entries.name: Stolen Sails
entries: You manifest the tattered masts of the ghostly ship, which drain the wind out of your enemies' sails. Your speed increases by 10 feet for 1 minute, and each creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. On a failed save, its speed is reduced by 10 feet for 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Learn from our Mistakes
entries: At 1st level, the crewmen of the Ghost Ship pass some of their nautical knowledge on to you. You gain proficiency with navigator's tools and vehicles (water). Additionally, you can determine whether or not an item is cursed by spending 1 minute examining it.

subclassFeature.name: Bosun's Lash
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you can conjure a ghastly officer as a bonus action on your turn, who cracks a spectral whip at a willing creature of your choice within 15 feet of you before vanishing. The creature takes {@damage 1d4} force damage and gains a bonus equal to the damage taken to the next attack roll or ability check it makes before the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Eternal Sailor
entries: Starting at 10th level, you gain some traits of the vessel's ghostly crew. You gain the following benefits:

items: You are immune to poison and disease.
You no longer need to breathe.
You can sink in water at a rate of 60 feet per round, moving at the start of your turn.
You suffer no penalties to your movement or attacks from being underwater.

subclassFeature.name: Skeleton Crew
entries: At 14th level, you gain the ability to summon the entire crew to fight at your side. As an action, you can manifest a {@creature skeleton crew|ABYSS} in an unoccupied space that you can see within 60 feet of you. The crew is friendly to you and follow your commands. Roll initiative for the crew, which has its own turn.

The {@creature skeleton crew|ABYSS} disappears after 1 hour, when it drops to 0 hit points, or if you lose your concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell). The {@creature skeleton crew|ABYSS}'s can use your warlock spell attack bonus and spell save DC in place of its own attack bonuses or save DCs.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: School of Hydromancy
entries: As a member of the School of Hydromancy, you focus your study on magic that conjures and manipulates water. Though detractors of this school believe it to be an overly specialized area of study, hydromancy spells actually cover a wide selection of the eight traditional schools of magic. Hydromancers can use their spells to protect themselves and their allies, disperse and destroy their foes, or do many other tasks. Though members of this school are most often sought out by shipmasters or the lords of coastal settlements, they can be found working in an array of diverse occupations and in varied environments.

subclassFeature.name: Hydromancy Savant
entries: Beginning when you select this school at 2nd level, the gold and time you must spend to copy a spell that has the {@filter hydromancy|spells|subschool=hydromancy 30 feet;hydromancy 60 feet;hydromancy 120 feet;hydromancy 150 feet;hydromancy 180 feet} tag into your spellbook is halved.

subclassFeature.name: Aqueous Magic
entries: Beginning at 2nd level, you can use magic leftover from your spells to conjure shallow pools of water. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher using a spell slot, you can create one of these pools centered on a point on the ground that you can see within 30 feet of you. The pool manifests as a 1-inch-deep layer of water on the ground. It covers a 10-foot-radius for a 1st-level spell slot, and the radius increases by 5 feet for each slot level higher than 1st. The pool lasts for 1 minute, and stays in the location it was created for its entire duration, even on inclines or if subjected to strong winds.

If you start your turn standing in one of these pools of water, your speed is increased by 10 feet until the end of the turn. Also, while standing in one of these pools you are aware of any hidden or {@condition invisible} creatures within 10 feet of you that are also standing within a pool conjured by this feature.
These pools count as bodies of water for your hydromancy spells, and pools that intersect count as the same body of water.

subclassFeature.name: Watery Transposition
entries: Starting at 6th level, when you cast a hydromancy spell of 1st level or higher and utilize the spell's hydromancy radius, you can choose to teleport to the point that you chose to cast the spell from. You teleport after the spell is cast.
You can use this feature twice. You regain all expended uses of it when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Command
entries: At 10th level, you add the {@spell conjure elemental|PHB} spell to your spellbook if it is not there already. If the spell is already in your spellbook, you add a wizard spell of your choice with the hydromancy tag instead. You can cast {@spell conjure elemental|PHB} without expending a spell slot. When you do so, you summon a {@creature water weird|MM} rather than one of the spell's normal options (the DM has the creature's game statistics). The {@creature water weird|MM} can be bound to one of the pools you create with your Aqueous Magic feature, or bound to a regular body of water.
Once you cast {@spell conjure elemental|PHB} in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest, though you can still cast it normally using an available spell slot.

If you use {@spell conjure elemental|PHB} to summon a {@creature water elemental|MM} or {@creature water weird|MM}, the spell has a casting time of 1 action, and the summoned creature disappears if your concentration is broken rather than becoming hostile to you.

subclassFeature.name: One with the Waves
entries: Starting at 14th level, the pools created with your Aqueous Magic feature become imbued with stronger magic. While you stand within one of these pools, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a +2 bonus to your AC.
You gain advantage on Constitution saving throws.
You are aware of any hidden or {@condition invisible} creatures that are also standing within a pool, regardless of distance.

optionalfeature.name: Boiling Breath
entries: You can spend 5 ki points to cast {@spell steam vent|ABYSS}.

optionalfeature.name: Breath of the Sea
entries: You can spend 5 ki points to cast {@spell drown|ABYSS}.

optionalfeature.name: Fluid State
entries: You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell aqueous form|ABYSS}, targeting yourself. You can speak, attack, and cast spells as normal while transformed by the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Forceful Flow
entries: You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell riptide|ABYSS}.

optionalfeature.name: Glacial Embrace
entries: You can spend 6 ki points to cast {@spell instant iceberg|ABYSS}.

optionalfeature.name: Grasp of the Deep Sea
entries: You can spend 5 ki points to cast {@spell crushing depths|ABYSS}.

optionalfeature.name: Instant Storm
entries: You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell aqueous blast|ABYSS}.

optionalfeature.name: Rippling Strike
entries: You can transfer the force of your strikes through water. Being underwater doesn't impose disadvantage on your unarmed strikes. Additionally, when you take the Attack action on your turn, you can spend 1 ki point to channel rippling energy around your form. For the rest of your turn, when you make an unarmed strike while you are within 5 feet of a body of water, you can choose a point within 30 feet of you that is within the same body of water. The attack is made as if you were at the chosen point, but you must use your own senses. When you hit a creature with such an attack, you can spend 1 ki point to attempt to push the target away. It must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the point you chose.

optionalfeature.name: Rising Sea Serpent
entries: You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell waterspout|ABYSS}.

optionalfeature.name: Scalding Stream
entries: You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell geyser|ABYSS}.

optionalfeature.name: Wave Dash
entries: You can spend 3 ki points to cast {@spell crashing wave|ABYSS}.

optionalfeature.name: Winter's Grasp
entries: You can spend 3 ki points to cast {@spell freeze|ABYSS}.

optionalfeature.name: Buried Treasure
entries: You can pinpoint the location of precious metals and stones, such as coins, gems, and jewelry, within 60 feet of you, even if you can't see or smell the material.

optionalfeature.name: Captain's Parrot
entries: Your familiar gains the ability to speak, read, and write two languages of your choice. It also learns the {@spell vicious mockery|PHB} cantrip, which it casts using your warlock spell save DC. When determining the spell's damage, your familiar is considered a spellcaster of the same level as you.

optionalfeature.name: Collector of Curses
entries: Cursed magic items don't count against the total number of items that you can attune to.

optionalfeature.name: Nautical Charts
entries: So long as you can see a body of water, you know your current location and the distance and direction to the nearest area of civilization, such as a fort, village, or town, that can safely feed and house you and creatures traveling with you.

optionalfeature.name: Quartermaster's Stockpile
entries: When you would summon your pact weapon, you can instead summon one piece of adventuring gear of your choice, so long as it isn't a piece of adventuring gear that is consumed when used. This piece of gear vanishes, reforms, and otherwise follows the same rules as your pact weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Replicate Magic Item
entries: This infusion adds a number of magic items from this book to the artificer's {@optfeature Replicate Magic Item|TCE} infusion.

optionalfeature.name: Sundertide Weapon
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. Attacks with this weapon are not made at disadvantage due to being underwater.

The weapon has 4 charges. While underwater, the wielder can expend 1 charge to cause the next attack to release a wave of rippling force through the water. The wave is a ranged spell attack with a range of 60 feet. You are proficient with it, and you add the weapon's normal modifier to its attack and damage rolls. In addition to the attack's normal effects, it deals an additional 1d8 cold damage. The weapon regains 1d4 expended charges daily at dawn.

prerequisite.pact: 6th level, A simple or martial weapon (requires attunement)

variantrule.name: Hydromancy
entries: Certain spells in this tome have the special tag: {@filter hydromancy|spells|subschool=hydromancy 30 feet;hydromancy 60 feet;hydromancy 120 feet;hydromancy 150 feet;hydromancy 180 feet}. Each spell with the hydromancy tag also notes a radius, in feet, which is the spell's {@bold hydromancy radius}. If you touch a body of water when casting a spell with this tag, you can choose a point within the hydromancy radius that is within the same body of water. The spell is cast as if you were at the chosen point, but you must use your own senses.

For example, if you cast a hydromancy spell with a range of touch, you can choose to touch a body of water as you cast the spell. When you do so, you can target any creature that is within reach of a point in the same body of water that is also within the hydromancy radius, rather than only being able to target creatures within your normal touch range.

entries.name: Hydromancy Feats
entries: This book also contains three feats that interact with the hydromancy tag: {@feat conductive hydromancer|ABYSS}, {@feat rime hydromancer|ABYSS}, and {@feat steam hydromancer|ABYSS}

entries.name: Optional: Adding the Hydromancy Tag
entries: The DM can choose to give the hydromancy tag to the following spells:

spell.name: Aqueous Blast
entries: You conjure a small ball of water and hurl it at a point you can see within range, which can be extended through hydromancy. The ball then expands in an explosive blast of water. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage and is pushed 20 feet away from the center of the sphere. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is pushed half as far.
The spell produces 50 gallons of water, which spreads out across the ground, extinguishing unprotected flames and forming a thin puddle in the area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d8} and the amount of water produced increases by 10 gallons for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Aqueous Form
entries: You transform a willing creature you touch into a pool of water for the duration. Any objects the target is carrying or wearing meld into its new form and are inaccessible, though it continues to be affected by anything it was wearing, such as armor. The spell ends if the creature drops to 0 hit points. While in this form, the target is under the following effects:

items: It gains a swimming speed of 30 feet, and can move over or through other liquids.
It is indistinguishable from a normal pool of water while it remains motionless, and is {@condition invisible} while underwater.
It has resistance to nonmagical damage, and it has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws.
It can't be {@condition grappled} or knocked {@condition prone}.
It can enter and occupy the space of another creature, and can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
It extinguishes nonmagical flames in any space it enters.
It can't talk, attack, or cast spells.

spell.name: Brine Sphere
entries: Choose a point you can see within range. You cause water within a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point to rapidly cool and increase in salinity. The area becomes foggy and lightly obscured for the duration, and a creature moving through the area must spend 3 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves.

When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 3d6} cold damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the spell ends. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}. If a {@condition poisoned} creature ends its turn outside of the sphere, it can make another Constitution saving throw, ending the condition on a success. Creatures that don't need to breathe or are holding their breath aren't {@condition poisoned} by this spell.
On each of your turns after you cast this spell, you can use an action to move the sphere up to 30 feet in any direction, so long as the sphere remains underwater.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d6} and the radius of the sphere increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Carve Gulf

m.text: an adamantine shovel and pick, each worth at least 500 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You cause a solid surface within range to shift and break apart, creating a chasm. You can make the chasm up to 5 miles long, 500 feet wide, and 100 feet deep. This spell splits earth and stone, but can't manipulate artificial construction. Man-made structures in the area of the chasm shift to accommodate the new terrain, moving harmlessly to whichever side of the chasm it is closer to. When complete, the chasm then fills with your choice of saltwater or freshwater, forming a gulf.

spell.name: Cold Snap

components.m: a tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur

entries: You rapidly lower the temperature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range, which can be extended through hydromancy. Each creature in the sphere must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 3d10} cold damage and is {@condition restrained} until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition restrained}, but its speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.
The spell freezes all nonmagical liquids with a volume of less than 1 gallon in open containers within the area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Corrosion

m.text: a drop of sea water and a black pearl worth at least 200 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You bestow a curse upon a 30-foot cube within range, eating away metal within the area. Each object thinner than 3 inches in any dimension made of metal within the area is destroyed (including nonmagical shields, weapons, and ammunition). Objects that aren't completely destroyed by the spell become coated with a layer of rust. Each nonmagical suit of medium or heavy armor made of metal within the area instead takes a permanent -5 penalty to the AC it offers. If the penalty reduces the armor's AC to 10 or lower, it is destroyed. Otherwise, the armor seizes at the joints, and a creature wearing it becomes {@condition restrained}. A creature {@condition restrained} by the armor can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC, freeing itself on a success.
Objects made of silver, gold, platinum, mithril, and adamantine are unaffected by this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you target an additional 30-foot cube for each slot level above 4th. Each cube must have at least one face adjacent to the face of another cube, and must originate from a point within range.

spell.name: Crashing Wave
entries: This spell allows you to move like water. When you cast this spell, and then as a bonus action on each of your turns until the spell ends, you can propel yourself up to 20 feet in a straight line. If this moves you into another creature's space for the first time on a turn, that creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast the spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the distance you can propel yourself increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Crushing Depths
entries: You manifest the pressure of the deep sea in a 20-foot-cube within range, which can be extended through hydromancy. The area becomes difficult terrain for the duration. Each creature within the area when the spell is cast must succeed on a Strength saving throw or become {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained} for the duration. Each creature that enters the spell's area for the first time on its turn or starts its turn there must also succeed on a Strength saving throw or become {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained} for the duration. A creature has advantage on the saving throw if it has a swimming speed, and automatically succeeds if it is immune to the effects of being underwater at a depth greater than 100 feet.

A creature {@condition restrained} by the spell that starts its turn within the area takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage, and can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on itself on a success.

When the spell ends, either because your concentration is broken or because you decide to end it, each creature {@condition restrained} by the spell takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage for each round that has passed since you cast the spell from the change in pressure.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the size of the cube increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Dairlain's Glimmering Trove
entries: The image of an overflowing chest of treasure appears in a space you can see within range. When a creature comes within 5 feet of the chest for the first time, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is entranced by the chest and is {@condition charmed} for the duration. While {@condition charmed} by this spell, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} and has a speed of 0.

At the end of each of its turns, an affected creature can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the target is no longer {@condition charmed}. The charm also ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

If a creature uses its action to examine the chest, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature and it becomes immune to the spell's effects.

spell.name: Drown
entries: You choose a creature you can see within range, which can be extended through hydromancy, and conjure a liquid within its lungs. Roll {@dice 12d8}; if the target has hit points equal to or fewer than the total, it begins suffocating and becomes unable to breathe or speak for the duration. If the target has hit points greater than the total, the spell is still cast but doesn't take effect until the target's hit points drop below the total. Creatures that don't have lungs, don't need to breathe, or can breathe water are unaffected by this spell. As an action, the creature can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.
Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on your turn to cause liquid to swell inside the target's lungs and cause it take {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, roll an additional {@dice 2d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Druid Cove

m.text: samphire, which the spell consumes, that was harvested with a silver sickle under the light of a new moon

entries: You invoke the spirits of nature to protect an area on  near the sea. The area can be as small as a 30-foot cube or as large as a 90-foot cube. Buildings and other structures are excluded from the affected area. If you cast this spell in the same area every day for a year, the spell lasts until dispelled.

The spell creates the following effects within the area. When you cast this spell, you can specify creatures as friends who are immune to the effects. You can also specify a password that, when spoken aloud, makes the speaker immune to these effects.

The entire warded area radiates magic. A {@spell dispel magic|PHB} cast on the area, if successful, removes only one of the following effects, not the entire area. That spell's caster chooses which effect to end. Only when all its effects are gone is this spell dispelled.

entries.name: Solid Fog
entries: You can fill any number of 5-foot squares on the ground with thick fog, making them heavily obscured. The fog reaches 10 feet high. In addition, every foot of movement through the fog costs 2 extra feet. To a creature immune to this effect, the fog obscures nothing and looks like soft mist, with motes of green light floating in the air.

entries.name: Clawing Eddy
entries: You can fill any number of 5-foot squares on the ground that aren't filled with fog with whirlpools, as if they were affected by a {@spell control water|PHB} spell. To a creature immune to this effect, the water is smooth and the current guides them around any treacherous areas.

entries.name: Cove Guardians
entries: You can animate up to three waves in the area, causing them to move on independently of the current. These wave have the same statistics as a {@creature water weird|MM}. If any creature not immune to this effect enters the warded area, the cove guardians fight until they have driven off or slain the intruders. The grove guardians also obey your spoken commands (no action required by you) that you issue while in the area. If you don't give them commands and no intruders are present, the cove guardians do nothing. The cove guardians can't leave the warded area. When the spell ends, the magic animating them disappears, and the waves return to the sea.

entries.name: Additional Spell Effect
entries: You can place your choice of one of the following magical effects within the warded area:

items: A constant {@spell riptide|ABYSS} in four locations of your choice
{@spell Plant growth|PHB} in one location of your choice
A {@spell steam vent|ABYSS} in one location of your choice

entries: To a creature immune to this effect, the water parts to allow them and any vehicle they are aboard to pass.

spell.name: Echoes of the Deep
entries: The sounds of the deep consume the minds of up to 10 creatures of your choice that you can see within range. Each creature experiences complete darkness, intense pressure, and the weight of water as they believe themselves dragged into the deepest trenches of the sea.
This illusion includes sound, temperature, pressure, and other stimuli, and produces the following affects for each affected creature.

items: The creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened}.

The creature takes {@damage 6d6} psychic damage at the start of each of its turns, which it perceives as bludgeoning damage from the pressure around it. Creatures that are immune to the effects of being underwater at a depth greater than 100 feet are immune to this effect.

The creature must hold its breath or begin immediately suffocating. If the creature attempts to breathe, speak, or open its mouth, it begins suffocating. Creatures with the ability to breathe underwater are immune to this effect.

The creature must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves, and has disadvantage on melee weapon attacks it makes with weapons other than daggers, javelins, shortswords, spears, or tridents. Creatures with a swimming speed are immune to this effect.

entries: A creature that uses an action to examine its surroundings can determine that it is experiencing an illusion by succeeding on an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature is no longer {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened}, can breathe normally, and no longer takes psychic damage from this spell at the start of its turn.

spell.name: Enhance Vehicle

m.text: 10 gp worth of quicksilver, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a vehicle that fits within a 30-foot cube and infuse it with energy. Until the spell ends, the vehicle gains a +2 bonus to its AC, and its speed increases by 10 feet. If the vehicle is pulled by one or more creatures, each creature's speed increases by 10 feet while it is pulling the vehicle.

Any enclosed spaces within the vehicle double in all dimensions, though this produces no visible change noticeable from outside of the vehicle. A creature that passes into the vehicle experiences the sensation of the space around it rapidly expanding when it enters the vehicle, and conversely experiences the outside world shrinking around it when it exits the vehicle.
If you cast this spell on the same vehicle every day for 30 days, the effect lasts until it is dispelled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the size of the cube increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Fey Fountain

m.text: 5 gp worth of gold dust, which the spell consumes

entries: You summon forth a spring of clear, cool water blessed with the restorative magic of the feywild. Choose a point within range. For the duration water flows from that point at a rate of 1 gallon every 10 minutes. Each creature that drinks at least a pint of water from this spring gains 10 temporary hit points. While a creature has these hit points, it has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to resist {@condition exhaustion}. The spell doesn't function if cast targeting a point of worked stone, such as in dungeons and towns, but does function underground.
Water produced by this spell retains its properties for the duration, after which it becomes nonmagical water.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, creatures that drink from the fountain gain 5 additional temporary hit points for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Figgly's Exploding Squid
entries: You summon a squid and fling it at a creature within range, which can be extended through hydromancy. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the squid explodes in a burst of ink. The target takes {@damage 1d12} piercing damage and becomes {@condition blinded} until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you summon an additional squid for each slot level above 1st. You can fling them at one target or several.

spell.name: Flood

m.text: a vial of ocean water and sapphire dust worth at least 100 gp

entries: You create a 50-foot-radius sphere of water centered on a point of your choice you can see within range. Until the spell ends, the sphere's radius increases by 5 feet at the beginning of each of your turn. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 6d8} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The water extinguishes all flames within the sphere.

When the spell ends, the sphere falls to the ground and forms a shallow pool of water with a radius equal to twice the sphere's radius, extinguishing all normal flames within the area. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Any creature in the sphere is knocked {@condition prone} in the space where it falls.

spell.name: Freeze
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach, whether through normal means or hydromancy. On a hit, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} cold damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature is not {@condition paralyzed}, and instead its speed is halved until the end of your next turn. If a creature affected by this spell takes damage, the spell ends early.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Frigid Strike
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before the spell ends, your weapon rimes with frost. The attack deals an extra {@damage 1d6} cold damage to the target, its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the spell ends, and it must make a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} until the spell ends. As an action, the creature can make a Strength check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@damage 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Fulminous Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack during the spell's duration, your weapon arcs with lightning, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 1d6} lightning damage to the target and causes the target to glow faintly until the spell ends. As a bonus action on your turn, you can dismiss this spell and cause a bolt of lightning to strike the target. Each creature within 5 feet of the target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} lightning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, both the initial extra damage and the damage dealt by the lightning bolt increase by {@damage 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Geyser

components.m: vinegar and a handful of salt

entries: You cause as a blast of steaming hot water to erupt in a 10-foot radius, 60-foot high cylinder centered on a point on the ground or on the surface of water that you can see within range, which can be extended through hydromancy. Each creature in the area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 3d6} fire damage damage and is knocked {@condition prone} if it is Medium or larger. On a successful save, it takes half damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}. A Tiny or Small creature that fails the save is not knocked {@condition prone}, but is instead flung 30 feet into the air, and lands {@damage 1d6}  5 feet away in a random direction.

Water created by this spell then rapidly boils away. If cast on a point on the ground, any loose earth or stone in the area becomes difficult terrain until cleared, with each 5-foot-diameter portion requiring at least 1 minute to clear by hand. If cast on a point on the surface of water, the spell deals an additional {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the bludgeoning damage or the fire damage (your choice) increases by {@damage 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Holy Hydropathy

m.text: 25 gp worth of powdered silver, which the spell consumes

entries: You imbue a pool of water with holy energy, creating a {@creature water weird|MM} in an unoccupied space within range. The {@creature water weird|MM} is bound to the pool of water, and dies if it leaves the water or if that water is destroyed. The {@creature water weird|MM} reverts back into nonmagical water when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The {@creature water weird|MM} is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the {@creature water weird|MM}, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to the {@creature water weird|MM}, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.

The {@creature water weird|MM}'s attacks deal an additional {@damage 2d6} radiant damage to fiends and undead. As an action, the {@creature water weird|MM} can reach out and touch a creature other than itself within 10 feet of it. The {@creature water weird|MM} takes {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage, which can't be reduced in any way, and the target regains a number of hit points equal to twice the necrotic damage taken.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the {@creature water weird|MM}'s maximum hit points increase by 20 for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Instant Iceberg
entries: You cause water to freeze within a 20-foot cube within range, forming an iceberg. Each creature in the area can make a Dexterity saving throw. On a success, it can use its reaction to move up to its speed so that it is no longer in the area. Otherwise, a target becomes trapped within the transparent ice. A creature in the iceberg is {@condition restrained} and has total cover against attacks and other effects that originate from outside of its own space.

The iceberg is a Gargantuan object with AC 12 and 100 hit points, and it is vulnerable to fire damage. It floats on the surface of water, and rises at a rate of 60 feet per round at the start of each of your turns if it is submerged in water. If the iceberg is reduced to 0 hit points, it shatters, freeing any creatures trapped within it.
When a creature moves more than 5 feet for the first time on a turn while standing on top of the iceberg, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast the spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, ice's maximum hit points increase by 20 and the size of the cube you can target increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Jonah's Hospitable Whale

m.text: a fragment of whalebone worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You name a destination and conjure a Gargantuan force in the form of a spectral whale, which appears in a body of water within range and lasts until the spell ends. If there isn't enough room for the whale to manifest, the spell fails. When it is conjured, the whale immediately devours you and up to 5 willing creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you, and then begins traveling toward the named destination, which must border a river, ocean, or other body of water, or be underwater. If the destination and your starting body of water are not connected by at least one water route, the spell fails.

The whale has a swimming speed of 300 feet, and can move 30 miles in an hour (240 miles in 8 hours). It travels at a depth of 30 feet in bodies of water that can accommodate it, or otherwise along the surface. Upon reaching your final destination, the whale disgorges you and all other passengers on the shoreline nearest the destination, and the spell ends. If the whale does not reach the destination by the time the spell ends, it discharges all creatures inside it on the nearest piece of solid ground.

The interior of the whale is warm, comfortable, and relatively dry, with enough air to sustain all passengers for the duration of the spell. Nothing—not physical objects, energy, or other spell effects—can enter or exit the whale. The whale is immune to all damage, and a creature or object inside can't be damaged by attacks or effects originating from outside, nor can a creature inside the whale damage anything outside it.
A {@spell disintegrate|PHB} spell targeting the whale destroys it without harming anything inside it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the whale's speed increases by 50 feet (5 miles per hour) for each slot levels above 5th.

spell.name: Kllimkaklaeia's Coral Corral

m.text: a chunk of coral worth at least 5 gp

entries: This spell creates an array of coral chunks, which float on the surface of a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you can see within range, which can be extended through hydromancy.

When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it. When an affected creature moves into or out of the sphere for the first time on a turn, bristling coral blooms from the coral chunk nearest to it, and the creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d4} piercing damage and be {@condition restrained} by the coral until the spell ends. A creature {@condition restrained} by the coral can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.
Additionally, the sphere grants half cover against attacks that pass into or out of it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, you create additional spheres of coral centered on the same point: a second 30-foot-radius sphere with a 5th-level slot, a third 45-foot-radius sphere with a 7th-level slot, and a fourth 60-foot-radius sphere with an 9th-level slot.

spell.name: Leviathan's Maw

m.text: a piece of coral from the Elemental Plane of Water worth 500 gp

entries: You manifest the jaws of a leviathan, erupting from a point on the ground or on the surface of water that you can see within range, which can be extended through hydromancy. Each creature within a 20-foot radius, 80-foot high cylinder centered on the point must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 12d6} force damage and is banished. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't banished.

If the spell is cast targeting a point on the ground, all creatures banished by this spell are transported to a harmless demiplane. Each creature remains there until the spell ends, at which point it reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

If the spell is cast targeting a point on the surface of a body of water, all creatures banished by this spell are transported to the Elemental Plane of Water. Each creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, and takes {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns. Each creature remains there until the spell ends, at which point it reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

spell.name: Liquefaction
entries: Each nonmagical object that is not being worn or carried in a 20-foot cube within range liquefies into water with the same appearance and shape of its original material. For example, a stone statue liquefied with this spell retains its shape, color, and appearance without collapsing or dripping. The water is retains the color and opacity of the object, potentially obscuring creatures and objects submerged in it. Water created with this spell can't be moved out of the spell's area, and magically refills if removed.
When the spell ends, the water solidifies back into solid matter, and each creature or object submerged within the water is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the size of the cube increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Liquid Sentinel

m.text: a flask of holy water worth 25 gp

entries: You shape water into an orb, which orbits around your head for the duration, granting you the following benefits:

items: You can adjust the orb's shape as an action, allowing it to function as either a {@item magnifying glass|PHB} or a {@item spyglass|PHB}.

When you cast this spell, or as an action on a later turn, you can focus light through the orb at point within 60 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} radiant damage. You can only make this attack when standing in bright light.
When you are hit by an attack, the orb intercepts the attack, reducing the damage you take by {@damage 1d6}. The spell then ends.

entries: The spell's damage and reduction both increase by {@damage 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Meandering Torrent
entries: You manipulate freestanding water within the spell's range, causing it to surge forward in a slithering path. Choose a point within range, which can be extended through hydromancy, that is within a body of water. The water moves in a 5-foot-wide path originating from that point. You can shape the path in any way you choose so long as it is continuous, doesn't intersect itself, and remains within range at all times. The length of this path is a number of feet equal to the number of gallons contained within the body of water you chose, up to a maximum length of 120 feet. Each creature in the path must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d10} bludgeoning damage and is pushed up to 20 feet along the path. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.
The spell moves the water used to form the path, up to 120 gallons of water, to the end of the path, where it pools up.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Misty Apparitions
entries: You release spectral fog, which mingles with the spirits of the dead and fills a 30-foot-radius sphere centered around you. The mist takes on the form of each creature that died in the area within the past 10 days, reenacting each creatures' last 1 minute of life before dispersing. The mist is incapable of leaving the spell's area, and only shows a creature's actions performed within the area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a slot of 5th level or higher, the mist takes on the forms of each creature that died within the past 1 year. If you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the mist takes on the forms of each creature that died within the past 10 years. If you use a spell slot of 9th level, the mist takes on the forms of each creature that died within the past 100 years.

spell.name: Phantom Galley
entries: A quasi-real ship appears on the surface of the water in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. You decide the ship's appearance. Any objects created by the spell as part of the ship vanishes in a puff of smoke if it is carried more than 10 feet away from the ship.

The ship is a Gargantuan force with an AC of 15 and 500 hit points, can carry up to 150 tons of creature and cargo, has a speed on the water of 50 feet (5 miles an hour), requiring no crew to steer or man it. Its speed increases to 60 feet (6 miles an hour) if it is sailing with the wind, and decreases to 30 feet (3 miles an hour) if it is sailing into the wind. You can command the ship to move, change directions, or stop as a bonus action on your turn. Otherwise, it maintains its previous bearing, moving at the end of your turn.

As an action before the spell ends, you can command the ship to unleash a volley of ethereal cannon fire in a 300-foot-long, 40-foot-wide line. Each creature in the line must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 8d10} force damage. You can make this attack three times, after which the ship runs out of ammo and becomes incapable of firing its cannons in this way again.

When the spell ends, the ship gradually fades over the course of 10 minutes, allowing creatures on board to disembark and offload any objects placed onto it. The spell ends early if you dismiss it as an action or if the ship is reduced to 0 hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the number of times you can fire the ship's cannons increases by 2 for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Plant Growth (Algal Bloom)
entries: This spell channels vitality into plants within a specific area. There are two possible uses for the spell, granting either immediate or long-term benefits.

If you cast this spell using 1 action, choose a point within range. All normal plants in a 100-foot radius centered on that point become thick and overgrown. A creature moving through the area must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves.
You can exclude one or more areas of any size within the spell's area from being affected.
If you cast this spell using 1 action and choose a point on the surface of a body of water, you can choose the following effect instead of the spell's normal effect:

entries.name: Algal Bloom
entries: This spell channels vitality into the water within a 100-foot radius circle on the surface of a body of water, causing a sudden bloom of life. The surface of the water in the area becomes opaque, covered by vibrant red algae, and the water in a 100-foot-radius, 100-foot-tall cylinder extending down from the surface in the area becomes unbreathable. Creatures within the cylinder that can breathe water are unable to breathe. Additionally, each creature that starts its turn in the cylinder must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn.

If you cast this spell over 8 hours, you enrich the land. All plants in a half-mile radius centered on a point within range become enriched for 1 year. The plants yield twice the normal amount of food when harvested.

spell.name: Pollute Water

m.text: a bottle of wormwood spirits, which the spell consumes

entries: You befoul water in a 100-foot cube originating from you. Any water that remains in the area during the entirety of the spell's casting time becomes fouled for the duration, even if it later leaves the area. When a creature drinks from the water, breathes in the water, or spends more than 1 minute within the water, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 24 hours. A {@condition poisoned} creature must repeat the saving throw every hour, taking {@damage 1d6} poison damage on a failed save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can befoul water in a 1,000-foot cube, and the water remains fouled for 30 days. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, you can befoul water in a 1-mile cube, and the water remains fouled until the spell is dispelled.

spell.name: Portal to the Depths
entries: You choose a point on the ground or on the surface of water that you can see within range, which can be extended through hydromancy, and transform a 20-foot radius area on the surface around the point into a portal into the deep ocean. When a creature moves through the portal, it appears in the depths: a 20-foot-radius column of water that extends downward indefinitely, with an opening at the top in the shape of the portal. A creature can enter or exit the depths by passing through the portal.
If the portal is on the surface of a body of water, the water within the depths count as part of that body of water.

When a creature starts its turn within the depths, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature take {@damage 4d6} cold damage, sinks 50 feet into the water, and becomes {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn. Additionally, if a creature starts its turn at a depth of 100 feet or more, it takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet of depth past 100 feet, to a maximum of {@damage 20d6}. Creatures that are native to the deep sea automatically succeed on this saving throw and are immune to all damage from this spell.

As a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends, you can cause water from the portal to leap out and grab at a creature you can see within 10 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be dragged through the portal, into the depths.
When the spell ends, any creatures and objects within the depths are shunted to the nearest unoccupied spaces within 5 feet of the portal.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the cold damage increases by {@damage 1d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Pressure Stream

m.text: garnet dust worth at least 5 gp

entries: A wire-thin stream of pressurized water shoots from your finger, with devastating yet precise cutting power at point-blank range. Make a melee spell attack against a creature or object you can reach, whether through normal means or hydromancy. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} slashing damage. If the target is a creature or object made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal, the spell deals maximum damage to it. You can't target an object that is being worn or carried by an unwilling creature.
The spell's damage increases by {@damage 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d8}), 11th level ({@damage 3d8}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d8}).

spell.name: Psychic Anchor
entries: Choose a creature you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw or become bound by a psychic anchor, which weighs it down and slows its movements. While weighed down, the creature's speed is reduced by 20 feet, it has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws that use Strength or Dexterity, and it sinks 30 feet at the start of its turn if it is swimming. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Intelligence saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional target for each slot level above 2nd. The targets must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Rain to Arrows

m.text: one piece of ammunition or one thrown weapon, which the spell consumes

entries: You can cast this spell only when it is raining. The spell forms a 30-foot-radius magic circle centered 120 feet above a point you can see within range. Any rain, natural or magical, that passes through the circle transforms into hundreds of duplicates of the ammunition or weapon. Each creature that starts its turn underneath the circle or enters the area for the first time on a turn must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 3d8} damage in light rain, or {@damage 6d8} damage in heavy rain. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. The damage type is the same as that of the ammunition or weapon.
In heavy rain, the ammunition and weapons created by this spell forms difficult terrain underneath the circle. Ammunition and weapons created by this spell revert back to water when the spell ends.

spell.name: Rime Rhyme
entries: You utter a chilling poem, targeting a creature that you can see within range, which can be extended through hydromancy. If the target can hear you (though it need not understand you), it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or it take {@damage 1d6} cold damage and begin to shiver violently until the spell ends. While shivering, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks. At the end of each of its turns, the target must make another Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 1d6} cold damage. On a success, the spell ends for the target. If the target takes any fire damage, the spell ends for it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Rippling Orb
entries: You hurl a rippling fist-sized mass of water at a creature within range, which can be extended through hydromancy. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage, and if the creature is Large or smaller, it is pushed up to 10 feet away from you. If you used hydromancy with this spell, the creature is instead pushed away from the point you chose to cast from.
This spell's damage increases by {@damage 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Riptide
entries: You create a fast current within a body of water, forming a line 90 feet long and 10 feet wide in a direction of your choice extending away from a point you can see within range. Each creature that starts its turn in the line must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and pushed 30 feet in the direction following the line.
A creature in the line must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot that it moves when moving against the tide.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, each creature in the line moving against the tide must spend an extra 1 foot of movement for every 1 foot it moves for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Sandbar
entries: You move loose earth and sand to form a barrier in a location you choose within range. The area of the spell consists of up to ten 5-foot cubes, which you can arrange as you wish. Each cube must have at least one face adjacent to the face of another cube.

Each 5-foot-cube is an object with AC 8, 15 hit points, and resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. When a 5-foot cube of sand is reduced to 0 hit points, it collapses, and might cause other cubes atop or adjacent to it to collapse to fill the space at the DM's discretion.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create two additional 5-foot cube for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Salt Spray
entries: A burst of salty ocean mist erupts from your palms, or from a point of your choice within the spell's hydromancy radius if extended through hydromancy. Each creature in a 15-foot cone make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes an additional {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage each time it takes any piercing or slashing damage before the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the additional damage increases by {@damage 1d4} for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Shell Shock

time.condition: which you take when you take damage

entries: A colorful layer of shell-like armor forms around your body, absorbing the triggering damage. Until the start of your next turn, you are immune to all damage, your speed is 0, you are {@condition incapacitated}, and attacks against you have advantage. The first time you deal damage to a creature with an attack or spell on your next turn, you can deal additional damage equal to the damage you would have taken while you were {@condition incapacitated}.

spell.name: Slippery Ice
entries: You create a layer of slick ice, 6 inches thick, in a 30-foot radius circle centered on a point on the ground or on the surface of water that you can see within range, which lasts for the duration. The ice suppresses any underlying terrain that doesn't protrude past the surface of the ice.

A creature moving across the ice spends 1 foot of movement for every 2 feet it moves, and must succeed a Dexterity saving throw when it moves more than 5 feet across the ice for the first time on a turn or be knocked {@condition prone}. When a creature attempts to get up from {@condition prone} while on the ice, it must succeed on a Dexterity check against your spell save DC. On a failure, it falls {@condition prone} again. When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to automatically succeed on ability checks and saving throws made against this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the radius of the ice increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Steam Vent
entries: You cause a 20-foot tall, 5-foot radius cylinder of searing steam to erupt from point on a surface you can see within range, which can be extended through hydromancy. The area fills with hot steam, and is heavily obscured until the start of your next turn or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes {@damage 6d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Being underwater doesn't grant resistance to this damage.

On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can use your action to create another vent in this way, targeting the same point or a different one. When you do so, any vents previously created by this spell cease to produce steam and disperse.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Striking Tide

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You wreath a weapon with aqueous energy, lashing out with the force of increasingly powerful tides. As part of the action used to cast this spell, you can make up to three melee attacks with a weapon. You can direct the attacks at the same target or at different ones. The first attack deals an additional {@damage 1d10} damage, the second attack deals an additional {@damage 2d10} damage, and the third attack deals an additional {@damage 3d10} damage.

spell.name: St. Eleanor's Fire

m.text: a lightning rod worth at least 100 gp

entries: You touch a Large or larger vehicle and conjure a corona of blue light, which gathers around any pointed elements on the vehicle. For the duration, ranged weapon attacks made against the vehicle or creatures riding the vehicle have disadvantage, as the corona of light dazzles attackers. Creatures aboard the vehicle and creatures with senses other than sight, such as blindsight, are unaffected by this effect.
If the vehicle is outdoors in stormy conditions, any ranged weapon attack made by creatures aboard it deal an additional {@damage 1d4} lightning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. If you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration is 8 hours. If you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the duration is 24 hours. If you use a 9th level spell slot, the spell lasts until it is dispelled. Using a spell slot of 5th level or higher grants a duration that doesn't require concentration.

spell.name: Sulfurous Squall
entries: A violent squall of sulfuric rain sweeps through a location you choose within range. The area of the squall consists of up to ten 10-foot cubes, which you can arrange as you wish. Each cube must have at least one face adjacent to the face of another cube. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@damage 4d8} acid damage on a failed save, and takes half as much damage on a successful one. The squall also damages objects not being worn or carried.

The area of the spell then becomes covered in yellow, caustic sulfur for the duration of the spell. The sulfur floats in place when cast on water or underwater, and clings to solid surfaces. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes {@damage 1d8} acid damage for every 5 feet it travels. The sulfur is flammable. If any part of the area comes into contact with fire, the entire area erupts into flames and burns away in 1 round, dealing {@damage 4d8} fire damage to any creature that starts its turn in the fire. The spell ends when the sulfur is burned away.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Terega's Treasure Map

m.text: at least a 6 inch square of skin or hide from a creature that has died within the past hour, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch the skin or hide of a slain creature and cause a map to form on its surface. The map details the geographic location of the most valuable object or hoard of objects known to the creature. The map is accurate to the creature's knowledge to a distance within 30 feet of the treasure, but does not show elevation, traps, or any markings to indicate what creatures or spells may protect the treasure. If the location of the object or hoard is on a different plane of existence as you, the spell fails.

spell.name: Torrential Culling

components.m: a rusted scythe that has been submerged in saltwater for a week

entries: You create a whirl of shadowy saltwater in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you can see within range, which can be extended through hydromancy. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} slashing damage and {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

If the damage from this spell reduces one or more creatures to 0 hit points, you can grant {@damage 4d8} temporary hit points to a number of creatures you can see within range equal to the number of creatures reduced to 0 hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level, the necrotic damage and temporary hit points increase by {@damage 1d8} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Waterspout
entries: You cause a spout of water to emerge from a 5-foot-square on the ground or on the surface of water that you can see within range, which can be extended through hydromancy. Water emerges to fill a 20-foot-tall cylinder with a 5-foot diameter that rises from the chosen square and lasts for the duration.

A creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Dexterity saving throw, which it can choose to fail. On a failed save, a creature is pushed to the top of the cylinder. On a successful save, a creature is pushed 5 feet out of the area into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is available, the creature automatically fails the saving throw.

The force of the water is enough to keep creatures aloft, though it is impossible for a creature to stand at the top of the waterspout unless it can normally stand on water. A creature that can't stand on water is {@condition prone} while it remains at the top of the cylinder.
Water created by this spell vanishes when the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the height of the cylinder increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Water Veil
entries: You create a thin veil of water on the ground at a point you can see within range, which can be extended through hydromancy. You can choose to make the veil up to 30 feet long and 10 feet high, or a circle that has a 10-foot diameter and is up to 10 feet high. The veil is 1 inch thick and transparent, but causes visual distortions of anything observed through it.

When a creature makes an attack, casts a spell, or uses an ability that targets a creature or object on the other side of the veil, roll a {@dice d20}. On a roll of 10 or lower, the attack, spell, or ability fails or misses.

spell.name: Wave Strike
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, rushing water surrounds the attack. The target takes an additional {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage, and must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target is pushed 15 feet away from you in a straight line.
If you hit a target that is submerged in water, each creature in a 15-foot cone behind the initial target must also succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Wellspring

m.text: diamond dust worth at least 5,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a pool of water that is fully contained within a 60-foot radius, blessing and purifying it. For the duration, the pool's contents becomes holy water. When a creature enters the water for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it regains 1 hit point if it is not a fiend or undead. A fiend or undead instead takes {@damage 2d6} radiant damage.
Additionally, any creature that spends 1 minute bathing in the water gains one of the following benefits:

items: One disease or condition afflicting the target is removed.
One curse, including the target's attunement to a cursed magic item, is ended.
Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores or maximum hit points is ended.
The target's lifespan is increased by {@dice 1d4} years. A creature can only gain this benefit once in its lifetime.

entries: Any water removed from the blessed pool loses these benefits, though it is clean, safe to drink, and has a pleasant mineral taste.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th-level or higher, the water remains blessed for 1 year. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the water is blessed until the spell is dispelled.

spell.name: Whaleoil
entries: You transform the flesh of a creature you can see within range into burning fuel. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 6d10} necrotic damage and ignites in flames. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't set ablaze. While ablaze, the target sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. At the start of each of the target's turns, it and each creature within 10 feet of it takes {@damage 2d10} fire damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.
If you target a creature without flesh, such as an ooze, iron golem, or skeleton, the spell fails.

entries.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th-level or higher, both the necrotic and fire damage increase by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Whirlpool Slash

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You swing a weapon with the force of a whirlpool. Each creature within 15 feet of you must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10 feet in a straight line toward you. As part of the action used to cast this spell, you can make a melee attack with a weapon at each creature that is pulled within 5 feet of you. If both you and the target are standing on or submerged in a body of water, you have advantage on the attack roll.

feat.name: Cannoneer
entries: Your familiarity with {@object ballista|DMG|ballistas}, {@object cannon|DMG|cannons}, and other heavy mounted weaponry grants you the following benefits:

items: You can load, aim, or fire a {@object ballista} or {@object cannon} as a bonus action on your turn.
When a {@object ballista} or {@object cannon} you loaded deals damage, you can reroll the weapon's damage dice and use either total.
When a {@object ballista} or {@object cannon} that you aimed is fired, you can add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll.
When you fire a {@object ballista} or {@object cannon}, attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on the ranged weapon attack roll.
If you spend 1 minute repairing a {@object ballista} or {@object cannon}, it regains hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your level.

feat.name: Conductive Hydromancer
entries: You have learned techniques to direct lightning spells through bodies of water, gaining the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell create or destroy water|PHB} spell and can cast it once without expending a spell slot or providing material components. You regain the ability to cast this spell in this way when you finish a long rest.
When you cast a spell using hydromancy, you can treat any bodies of water that are less than 10 feet apart at any point as a single body of water.
When you cast a spell that deals lightning damage, it gains the hydromancy tag with a hydromancy radius of 30 feet.

Once per turn when you deal lightning damage to a creature with a spell cast using hydromancy, you can cause it to take an additional {@damage 1d8} lightning damage, or {@damage 1d12} lightning damage if the creature is submerged in water.

feat.name: Expert Fisherman
entries: Experienced in the behavior and motions of aquatic prey, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Intelligence (Nature), Wisdom (Animal Handling), and Wisdom (Survival) checks made when interacting with aquatic creatures.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to spot creatures and phenomena underwater.
When you make an attack at a target that is submerged in water on your turn in combat, you can use a bonus action to steady your aim in order to gain advantage on the attack roll.
If you are proficient with nets, you can add your proficiency bonus to the DC for the Strength check required to free a creature from a net you threw.

feat.name: Fanatical Devotion
entries: Your intense worship and piety grant you the following benefits:

items: When you create a {@creature kuo-toa idol} using God Making, it remains for 8 hours instead of 1 hour, and is created with a number of temporary hit points equal to your level.

While you are within 10 feet of your {@creature kuo-toa idol} and can see  it, you have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws, and can't be {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed}.

feat.name: Heavy Carapace
entries: Your carapace hardens and grows more dense, granting you the following benefits:

items: When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.
You have advantage on Strength checks and saving throws made against effects that would push you or knock you {@condition prone}.
Your pincers gain the heavy property, and you can deal bludgeoning or slashing damage (your choice) equal to {@damage 1d8} + your Strength modifier when you hit with them.

feat.name: Rime Hydromancer
entries: You have learned techniques to direct your hydromancy through ice and snow, and to direct cold spells through bodies of water, gaining the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell water walk|PHB} spell and cast it once without expending a spell slot or providing material components. When you cast the spell in this way, it is only capable of targeting yourself, only allows you to move across the surface of liquid water, and leaves shards of ice in your wake. You regain the ability to cast this spell in this way when you finish a long rest.
You can treat a body of snow or ice as a body of water when casting spells with the hydromancy tag.
When you cast a spell that deals cold damage, it gains the hydromancy tag with a hydromancy radius of 30 feet.
While you are fully submerged in water, you have resistance to cold damage.

feat.name: Steam Hydromancer
entries: You have learned techniques to direct your hydromancy spells through water vapor, and to direct fire spells through bodies of water, gaining the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell fog cloud|PHB} spell and can cast it once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast this spell in this way when you finish a long rest.
You can treat an area of fog, mist, or steam as a body of water when casting spells with the hydromancy tag.
When you cast a spell that deals fire damage, it gains the hydromancy tag with a hydromancy radius of 30 feet.
Fire damage dealt by spells you cast using hydromancy ignores resistance granted from being underwater.

feat.name: Sure-Footed
entries: Experienced with shifting terrain or the rocking and swaying of ships out at sea, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to resist being knocked {@condition prone}.

When a creature within 5 feet of you fails an ability check or saving throw against an effect that would knock it {@condition prone}, you can use your reaction to allow the creature to reroll the ability check or saving throw if you have at least one hand free.

feat.name: Swimmer
entries: You have undergone extensive aquatic training to gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a swim speed equal to your walking speed.
You can hold your breath a number of minutes equal to 2 + twice your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 minute).
When you fall into water, you take no bludgeoning damage from the fall if you are not {@condition incapacitated}.
You can't be knocked {@condition prone} while you are underwater.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The kuo-toa idol sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Skeleton Crew
languages: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

trait.name: Horde
entries: The crew can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the horde can move through any opening large enough for a Medium skeleton. Additionally, the crew is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The crew can take one reaction on every turn in combat.

trait.name: Horde Turn Resistance
entries: The crew has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead. Additionally, the crew can be affected by the Destroy Undead feature regardless of CR limits, but has advantage on the saving throw against it and is not destroyed on a failed save. Instead, it takes radiant damage equal to 10  the cleric's level on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The crew makes four attacks, or two attacks if the crew has half its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Cutlass
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Volley
entries: The crew fires a simultaneous barrage of pistol shots. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 44 ({@damage 8d10}) piercing damage, or 22 ({@damage 4d10}) piercing damage if the crew has half its hit points or fewer. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the volgoth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Crushing Movement
entries: The first time the volgoth moves into a space occupied by a creature or object on a turn, it can attempt to ram into it.
