entries: Formed from clumps of cosmic dust, nebula dragons are born of chaos. Their personalities are likewise chaotically inclined, knowing neither good nor evil. Due in part to their isolation from other living creatures, nebula dragon are extremely self-centered, having no concept of compassion, sympathy, or empathy.

trait.name: Spacefaring
entries: The dragon doesn't need to breathe.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The squid makes two attacks, only one of which can be a beak attack.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the squid can't use its tentacles on another target.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the squid, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Plasma Cloud (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: A 20-foot-radius cloud of scorching plasma extends all around the squid. The area is heavily obscured for 1 minute, although a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) can disperse the cloud. When the cloud appears, each creature in it must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. After releasing the cloud, the squid can use the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action.
High in the sky, miles above the atmosphere, a number of creatures have developed specialized traits that allow them to survive in otherwise inhospitable environments.

entries.name: Dust and Debris
entries: Without typical sources of sustenance, some space creatures have developed a peculiar diet. Chief among these is the space squid, which manages to subsist on a diet of space dust, supplemented with space jellyfish. It generates energy through a combined process of fission and fusion, breaking apart the dust and reforming it in order to create energy. In a pinch, it can expel its meal as a cloud of hot plasma, allowing it to scorch predators and escape from harm.

trait.name: Spacefaring
entries: The whale doesn't need to breathe.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The whale has advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} 33 ({@damage 6d8 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the whale. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the whale, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage at the start of each of the whale's turns.

If the whale takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the whale must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the whale. If the whale dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.
High in the sky, miles above the atmosphere, a number of creatures have developed specialized traits that allow them to survive in otherwise inhospitable environments.

entries.name: Cosmic Hunters
entries: Another species of ecological significance in space is the gargantuan space whale, the primary predator of the space squids. Unlike the squid, space whales do not have a method of converting space dust into energy, and thus resort to hunting space squids and other rare cosmic creatures for food.

entries.name: Astrambergris
entries: This diet of space squids results in a build-up of the squids' indigestible beaks within the space whales' intestinal tracts. Over the course of many years, these beaks merge with chemicals within the whale's innards, forming into a lump of stony substance called astrambergris. This substance, produced solely from the guts of the rare space whales, is mysterious and extraordinarily valuable. It is touted to have uses in powerful elixirs and potions, and is highly sought after by alchemists and magicians alike.

trait.name: Spacefaring
entries: The polyp doesn't need to breathe.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The polyp sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The polyp makes {@dice 1d4} star mote attacks.

action.name: Star Mote
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 2} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h} 3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) force damage.
High in the sky, miles above the atmosphere, a number of creatures have developed specialized traits that allow them to survive in otherwise inhospitable environments.

entries.name: Deep Space Drifters
entries: Floating high above the atmosphere, tiny space jellyfish flutter about in the dark, casting their dim light like tiny stars. They, like the space squid, gather and consume space dust for energy. An unfortunate side effect of their diet is the propensity to glow, making them easily visible targets for hungering space squids.
When a space jellyfish reaches maturity, it attaches itself to a large chunk of debris and becomes a space polyp. Using the energy gathered from space dust, it slowly produces more space jellyfish.

trait.name: Spacefaring
entries: The jellyfish doesn't need to breathe.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The jellyfish sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius.
High in the sky, miles above the atmosphere, a number of creatures have developed specialized traits that allow them to survive in otherwise inhospitable environments.

entries.name: Deep Space Drifters
entries: Floating high above the atmosphere, tiny space jellyfish flutter about in the dark, casting their dim light like tiny stars. They, like the space squid, gather and consume space dust for energy. An unfortunate side effect of their diet is the propensity to glow, making them easily visible targets for hungering space squids.
When a space jellyfish reaches maturity, it attaches itself to a large chunk of debris and becomes a space polyp. Using the energy gathered from space dust, it slowly produces more space jellyfish.

trait.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: The satellite can magically communicate simple ideas, emotions, and images telepathically with any creature within 100 feet of it that can understand a language.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The satellite has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} 3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shell Smash (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The satellite forcefully bursts its shell. Each creature within 5 feet of the satellite must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 7 ({@damage 3d4}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. After using this, the satellite's armor class becomes 11 and its flying speed increases to 50 feet.

action.name: Gleam (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The satellite shines brightly. Each creature within 5 feet of the satellite must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

reaction.name: Intercept Attack
entries: When a creature the satellite can see within 5 feet of it is hit by an attack, the satellite can swap places with the creature and become the target of the attack instead.

entries.name: Pact of the Chain Option
entries: At 3rd level, a warlock gains the Pact Boon feature. The satellite is an additional familiar option available to warlocks of the {@class Warlock|PHB|The Nebula|The Nebula|ATLAS} patron who select the Pact of the Chain.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the star devourer fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Spacefaring
entries: The star devourer doesn't need to breathe.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The star devourer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The star devourer deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Astral Hide
entries: Any time the star devourer is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 4 to 6, the star devourer is unaffected, and the spell disappears into a void on its hide.

trait.name: Death Burst Nova
entries: When the star devourer dies, it explodes, and each creature within 600 feet of it must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 70 ({@damage 20d6}) fire damage and 70 ({@damage 20d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. After the explosion, the star devourer's body becomes a dense spherical black hole, 5 feet in diameter. Each creature within 120 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be pull into the black hole and take 70 ({@damage 20d6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The star devourer can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its tail. It can use its Swallow instead of its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h} 49 ({@damage 6d12 + 10}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the star devourer can't bite another target.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h} 43 ({@damage 6d10 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the star devourer's choice within 120 feet of it and is aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the star devourer is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the star devourer's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The star devourer makes one bite attack against a Huge or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the star devourer, and it takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) bludgeoning damage and 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage at the start of each of the star devourer's turns.

If the star devourer takes 60 damage or more in a single turn from a creature inside it, the star devourer must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the star devourer.

action.name: Inhale (Recharge 4-6)
entries: The star devourer pulls creatures and objects alike towards its mouth. Each creature within a 60-foot cone originating from the star devourer must make a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 30 feet toward it. If a creature comes within 10 feet of the star devourer, the star devourer can immediately make a bite attack at it.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The star devourer makes one tail attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The star devourer moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Chomp (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The star devourer makes one bite attack or uses its Swallow.

A mythical creature from the depths of space, the star devourer is a titan that consumes all forms of matter to fill its never-ending hunger. Denizens of space shudder when the stars flicker, for fear of its arrival. Constantly wandering from meal to meal, a star devourer has no lair.

entries.name: Ancient Abomination
entries: No one knows how the star devourer came to be, and it is unknown whether it is a singular entity or merely a member of a terrifying species. It has been witnessed throughout the ages as a harbinger of darkness, crushing distant stars in a path of destruction across the sky. Astronomers have observed vast pockets of darkness in the night sky, unexplained by their calculations or science, that ultimately have been attributed to the maw of this monstrous creature.

trait.name: Stardust Form
entries: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. In addition, the elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, or if a creature starts its turn within the elemental's space,  that creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The elemental sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two touch attacks.

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) radiant damage.

action.name: Gleam (Recharge 4-6)
entries: Each creature within 30 feet of the elemental must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a target takes half as much damage and is not {@condition blinded}.

A star elemental is a glowing mass of starlight with a vague semblance of a face. They are a strange variant of their fire elemental kin, channeling their energy as light and heat. As they are constructed of luminous plasma, direct contact with a star elemental can be dangerous.

entries.name: Denizens of Space
entries: Rather than occupying any of the elemental planes, star elementals can be found deep in space or adrift in the astral plane.

entries.name: Elemental Nature
entries: Like their other elemental kin, a star elemental doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

monster.name: Star Elemental Myrmidon
languages: one language of its creator's choice

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The myrmidon sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The myrmidon's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The myrmidon makes three morningstar attacks.

action.name: Morningstar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Radiant Strikes (Recharge 6)
entries: The myrmidon uses Multiattack. Each attack that hits deals an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) radiant damage.

A star elemental is a glowing mass of starlight with a vague semblance of a face. They are a strange variant of their fire elemental kin, channeling their energy as light and heat. As they are constructed of luminous plasma, direct contact with a star elemental can be dangerous.

entries.name: Denizens of Space
entries: Rather than occupying any of the elemental planes, star elementals can be found deep in space or adrift in the astral plane.

entries.name: Elemental Nature
entries: Like their other elemental kin, a star elemental doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Myrmidon
entries: Elemental myrmidons are elementals conjured and bound by magic into ritually created suits of plate armor. In this form, they possess no recollection of their former existence as free elementals. They exist only to follow the commands of their creators.

Though star elemental myrmidon bear several resemblances to the {@race starforged|ATLAS}, they spring into existence already possessing sentience, but unable to act against the commands of their creators.

trait.name: Immeasurable Density
entries: The elemental is composed of extremely densely packed matter, forming a crushing field around it. When a creature moves within 10 feet of the elemental or starts its turn within the 10 feet of the elemental, that creature takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) bludgeoning damage. Additionally, a creature within 10 feet of the elemental must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves away from the it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} 11 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Gravitational Pull (Recharge 4-6)
entries: Each creature within 30 feet of the elemental must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 15 feet toward it.

A star elemental is a glowing mass of starlight with a vague semblance of a face. They are a strange variant of their fire elemental kin, channeling their energy as light and heat. As they are constructed of luminous plasma, direct contact with a star elemental can be dangerous.

entries.name: Denizens of Space
entries: Rather than occupying any of the elemental planes, star elementals can be found deep in space or adrift in the astral plane.

entries.name: Elemental Nature
entries: Like their other elemental kin, a star elemental doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Death of a Star
entries: As star elementals go through their lives, they gather space dust and fuse it inside their body, providing energy in the form of heat and pressure. When the fuel inside a star elemental begins to run out, the pressure inside the elemental wanes, and the gravitational forces of its accrued stardust eventually collapse in on itself. This process forms an extraordinarily dense point of matter, a black hole elemental. Black hole elementals continue as star elementals do, consuming matter to subsist.

entries.name: Singularity
entries: At the core of a black hole elemental lies a gravitational singularity, a region of nearly infinite density where the laws of space and time are corrupted. Forming around the core, a vaguely humanoid event horizon leeches away any light shined upon the elemental, giving it a darker-than-black appearance. Anything that passes this threshold is crushed by the black hole elemental's incredible gravitational field.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The hooded nebula's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 30 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Solar Sail
entries: Whenever the hooded nebula is subjected to radiant damage, it takes no damage and instead can immediately move up to half its speed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hooded nebula makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} 17 ({@damage 2d12 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Deadly Leap
entries: If the hooded nebula jumps at least 15 ft. as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) slashing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 ft. out of the hooded nebula's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the hooded nebula's space.

action.name: Gleam (Recharge 4-6)
entries: The hooded nebula fans open its hood, releasing a blast of light in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a target takes half as much damage and is not {@condition blinded}.

A star elemental is a glowing mass of starlight with a vague semblance of a face. They are a strange variant of their fire elemental kin, channeling their energy as light and heat. As they are constructed of luminous plasma, direct contact with a star elemental can be dangerous.

entries.name: Denizens of Space
entries: Rather than occupying any of the elemental planes, star elementals can be found deep in space or adrift in the astral plane.

entries.name: Elemental Nature
entries: Like their other elemental kin, a star elemental doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Sun-Sailing Lizards
entries: Traveling the depths of space are the hooded nebula, elemental lizards bearing magnificent neck frills that store and release sunlight.
Hooded nebula are innately curious creatures, and travel from world to world in to satisfy their thirst for knowledge.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The astrid's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Elemental Demise
entries: If the astrid dies, its body disintegrates in a burst of light, leaving behind only equipment the astrid was wearing or carrying.

trait.name: Spacefaring
entries: The astrid doesn't need to breathe.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The astrid makes three longbow attacks.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Blinding Teleport
entries: The astrid releases a burst of light, and then magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Each creature within 30 feet of the astrid when it teleports must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of the astrid's next turn.

Spacefaring genies that live among the stars, the astrid are tall and slender, with pale skin that glows softly of starlight. Crowned with shining gold and silken ribbon, they fly through the sky in a graceful cosmic dance, leaving a trail of stardust behind them as they pass.

entries.name: Capricious Twinkle
entries: Among the stars, the astrid rarely receive visitors. As such, their tendencies as hosts are rather peculiar. Bearing little concept of wealth, morality, and ownership, an astrid may presume that artifacts and objects brought before it by its visitors are intended as gifts, and will not hesitate to take hold of anything that catches its eye.

entries.name: Hunter of Stars
entries: The denizens of the stars alongside the astrids know better than to trifle with the pale genies. Powerful archers wielding bows of light, with the ability to blink across the sky in chase, the astrid are formidable hunters. Astrid rarely engage with the other genies, preferring the isolation of space.

entries.name: Shine Bright
entries: Playful and luminescent, astrids leap and bound across the night sky, performing a cosmic dance to any stargazers below. From a distance, the dancing lights pose a spectacular show. For those up close, however, the bright lights and stray arrows of the astrid's dance can pose hazardous.

entries.name: Variant: Genie Powers
entries: Genies have a variety of magical capabilities, including spells. A few have even greater powers that allow them to alter their appearance or the nature of reality.

entries.name: Disguises
entries: Some genies can veil themselves in illusion to pass as other similarly shaped creatures. Such genies can innately cast the {@spell disguise self} spell at will, often with a longer duration than is normal for that spell. Mightier genies can cast the {@spell true polymorph} spell one to three times per day, possibly with a longer duration than normal. Such genies can change only their own shape, but a rare few can use the spell on other creatures and objects as well.

entries.name: Wishes
entries: he genie power to grant wishes is legendary among mortals. Only the most potent genies, such as those among the nobility, can do so. A particular genie that has this power can grant one to three wishes to a creature that isn't a genie. Once a genie has granted its limit of wishes, it can't grant wishes again for some amount of time (usually 1 year). and cosmic law dictates that the same genie can expend its limit of wishes on a specific creature only once in that creature's existence.

To be granted a wish, a creature within 60 feet of the genie states a desired effect to it. The genie can then cast the wish spell on the creature's behalf to bring about the effect. Depending on the genie's nature, the genie might try to pervert the intent of the wish by exploiting the wish's poor wording. The perversion of the wording is usually crafted to be to the genie's benefit.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Comet
entries: Blasting across the battlefield in a shell of fire and ice, barbarians who follow the path of the comet are blessed with tremendous speed and power. As with the celestial voyagers that pass overhead, so too do these warriors put on brilliant displays, engraved in the hearts and minds of those that witness them.

entries.name: Coldfire Slam
entries: Starting when you choose this path at 3rd level, you channel the power of comets when you slam into enemies. While you are raging, you can surround yourself with a layer of either fire or ice. When you shove a creature, it takes damage equal to your Strength modifier plus your rage bonus damage if you win the contested ability check. The damage is cold or fire; you choose the type of damage when you begin your rage.

entries.name: Comet Dash
entries: At 3rd level, the cosmic powers you emulate allow you to barrel through your opponents. When you move straight towards a creature and then make a melee weapon attack or shove, the creature takes an additional {@damage 1d6} damage for each 10 feet you move straight toward it before the attack or shove, up to a maximum of {@damage 3d6}. This maximum increases to {@damage 4d6} at 6th level, {@damage 5d6} at 10th level, and {@damage 6d6} at 14th level. The damage is the same type as your Coldfire Slam.

subclassFeature.name: Shoot Across the Sky
entries: At 6th level, your speed empowers your ability to leap. While you are raging, your jump distance is tripled, and you do not take fall damage from a height of less than 100 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Coldfire Aura
entries: At 10th level, the comet that surrounds you expands. At the start of your turn while you are raging, each creature within 5 feet of you takes {@damage 1d6} damage. The damage is the same type as your Coldfire Slam.

subclassFeature.name: Cosmic Charge
entries: At 14th level, your charge is nigh unstoppable. When you take the {@action Dash} action, you can move through the spaces of Large or smaller creatures. Each creature you move through must make a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, they are knocked {@condition prone}.

subclassFeature.name: College of Superstars
entries: The College of Superstars is home to the most ambitious performers, artists, singers, and dancers. Bards of this college seek to dazzle audiences with their brilliance and talent, competing endlessly with one another to become the world's brightest star.

entries.name: Steal the Show
entries: When you join the College of Superstars at 3rd level, you learn use your performance to cover for your allies. When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll or ability check, you can use your reaction to steal the show. Make a Charisma (Performance) check and replace the original attack roll or ability check with the result, even if it is lower.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

entries.name: Live Show
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you hone your ability to shine as a performer.

If you perform for at least 10 minutes, you can attempt to inspire awe in your audience by singing, acting, dancing, or speaking. At the end of your performance, choose a number of creatures equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one). Each creature gains a {@dice d4} Bardic Inspiration die. This die lasts for a number of hours equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one), instead of 10 minutes. Using this feature does not expend any uses of your Bardic Inspiration.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Star Power
entries: At 6th level, you learn to use your renown as a performer to your advantage. When you make an ability check using Charisma, you can expend a use of your Bardic Inspiration as a reaction and add the die to the check.

subclassFeature.name: Idol's Aura
entries: At 14th level, your mere presence is enough to sweep most off their feet. As an action, you can expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration to exude an aura around you.

For 1 minute, whenever you or a friendly creature within 10 feet of you must make an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, the creature gains a bonus to the roll equal to your Charisma modifier (with a minimum bonus of +1). You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Sky Domain
entries: The gods that govern the sky are held in high regard by many religions. Deities of the sky include Zeus and Tyr, among various others. Followers of these deities often travel far to sate their wanderlust and feel the beauty of the open sky

subclassFeature.name: Variant: Alternative Spells
entries: For players who do not have access to Xanathar's Guide to Everything, the domain spells {@spell skywrite|XGE}, {@spell storm sphere|XGE}, {@spell control winds|XGE}, and {@spell maelstrom|XGE} can be replaced with {@spell gust of wind}, {@spell ice storm}, {@spell cone of cold}, and {@spell telekinesis} respectively.

subclassFeature.name: Tailwind
entries: Also at 1st level, the blessing of your god grants you unmatched grace and mobility. Your movement speed increases by 10 feet if you are not wearing medium or heavy armor.

subclassFeature.name: Forceful Gale
entries: At 1st level, you gain the ability to manipulate the winds. You learn the {@spell gust} cantrip, which doesn't count against the number of cleric cantrips you know. For you, it gains the following changes:

items: One Large or smaller creature that you choose must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be flung up 20 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

You create a blast of air capable of moving one object that weighs no more than 100 pounds. If the object is being held or carried, the holder must make a Strength saving throw or lose hold of it. The object is pushed up to 60 feet away from you.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Updraft
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to create a powerful blast of wind. As an action, you present your holy symbol and invoke the name of your deity. Choose a Large or smaller creature within 60 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be blown upwards up to 30 feet. A target can choose to automatically fail this saving throw. If the target doesn't have a hover or fly speed, it immediately falls afterwards, taking fall damage and landing {@condition prone}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Protection of Wind
entries: At 6th level, the gusts and breezes protect you from harm. As a reaction when you are hit by a ranged weapon attack you can see, you can use your Channel Divinity to create a gust of wind around you, causing the attack to miss.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Strike
entries: At 8th level, you gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra {@damage 1d8} thunder damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to {@damage 2d8}.

subclassFeature.name: Blessed Wings
entries: At 17th level, your god places upon you the blessing of true flight. You grow a pair of wings, which grant you a flying speed of 60 feet. If you already have a flying speed, it increases to 90 feet, unless it is already higher. You can't use these wings while wearing armor unless the armor is made to accommodate them.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Constellations
entries: Druids who are members of the Circle of Constellations live nocturnally. On star-speckled nights, when the skies are clear, druids of the circle tell tales of shapes in the stars, of the beasts that dance across the velvety sky, and of the magic woven by the twinkling specks of light that hang above.

entries.name: Starlight Shapes
entries: At 2nd level, your beast forms become infused with starlight when you use your Wild Shape. While you are transformed, you gain the following benefits:

items: You can emit bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. You can activate or suppress this light as a bonus action. While this light is suppressed, you can use an action to become {@condition invisible} while in dim light and darkness, even to creatures with darkvision. This effect ends if you attack or cast a spell.
Your melee weapon attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d4} force damage. This damage increases to {@damage 1d6} at 6th level, {@damage 1d8} at 10th level, and {@damage 1d10} at 14th level.
As a bonus action, you can grant yourself resistance to slashing, piercing, and bludgeoning damage from nonmagical attacks until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Starline
entries: At 2nd level, your stellar powers allow you to create your own constellations. As a bonus action, you can place a mote of starlight in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. This mote emits dim light in a 5-foot radius, and lasts for 1 minute. You can have a number of motes equal to 1 plus half your druid level.

As an action, you can form strands of starlight between all motes within 60 feet of you. If two motes are separated by a barrier or other solid object, the strand between them will not form. If a strand passes through a creature, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw against your druid spell save DC, taking {@damage 1d10} radiant damage for each mote placed on a failed save. Once you use this action, all the motes disappear.

subclassFeature.name: Constellation Companion
entries: At 6th level, you learn to form the starlight within yourself into more forms. When you use your Wild Shape, you can create a starlight beast in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of you, rather than transform. This creature can take the shape of any beast you are able to transform into using Wild Shape. The starlight beast acts on your initiative and has the stats of a normal creature, but gains the benefits of your Starlight Shapes as well.
This beast disappears after a number of hours equal to half your druid level (rounded down), if it is reduced to 0 hit points, or if you use this feature again to create another starlight beast.

subclassFeature.name: Starline Runner
entries: At 10th level, you learn to walk on the connections between stars. While you are within 5 feet of a mote, you can use your bonus action to teleport to another mote within 30 feet of it that is not separated by a barrier or other solid object. When you do so, you create a strand of light between the two motes. Each creature that the strand passes through must make a Dexterity saving throw against your druid spell save DC, taking {@damage 1d10} radiant damage on a failed save.

subclassFeature.name: Constellate Body
entries: At 14th level, the power of the stars has infused your very being. You gain the benefits of your Starlight Shapes even when not in your Wild Shape.

subclassFeature.name: Meteor Knight
entries: Fighters who fight like falling stones, Meteor Knights are uniquely specialized in utilizing blunt weaponry to their maximum effectiveness. Fighters of this school typically prefer maces, warhammers, and mauls, although some utilize staves and clubs to resounding effect.

entries.name: Heavy Hitter
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn how to accelerate the impact of your blows for maximum effect. Once per turn, whenever you deal more than 10 damage to a creature with a melee attack using a weapon that deals bludgeoning damage, you can force it to make a Strength saving throw or suffer one of the following effects:

items: The creature is pushed 10 feet away from you.
The creature drops one object of your choice that it is holding, which lands at its feet.

entries: The DC for these saving throws is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Brace for Impact
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn to brace against otherwise devastating blows. As a reaction to taking more than 10 damage, you can hold strong against the impact and reduce the damage by {@dice 1d10}. This increases to {@dice 2d10} at 10th level, {@dice 3d10} at 15th level, and {@dice 4d10} at 18th level.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Starstruck
entries: At 7th level, you can daze an opponent with your blows. Whenever you hit a creature with a melee attack using a weapon that deals bludgeoning damage, you can force it to make a Constitution saving throw against your Heavy Hitter save DC. On a failed save, it becomes {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Strength modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Meteor Shower
entries: At 10th level, you shrug off blows with a shower of sparks. When you reduce damage from a melee weapon attack using your Brace for Impact feature, the attacker takes fire damage equal to the damage reduced.

subclassFeature.name: Impact
entries: At 15th level, you learn to channel your strikes in a destructive wave. As an action, you can slam the ground with a weapon that does bludgeoning damage. Each creature within 10 feet of you that is not behind total cover must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Heavy Hitter save DC. A creature takes {@damage 4d10} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage and is not knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one.
If you use this feature immediately after falling, the damage dealt by this feature increases by {@damage 1d6} for every 10 feet you fell.

subclassFeature.name: Rock Body
entries: At 18th level, your physical form has become accustomed to the heat and shock from your style of combat. You gain immunity to fire damage and bludgeoning damage from nonmagical attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Void
entries: Monks that follow the traditions of the Way of the Void look to the spaces between the stars for inspiration in their techniques. Their training emphasizes emptiness of mind and body, and monks of this tradition spend long hours in fasting and meditation.

entries.name: Void Techniques
entries: At 3rd level, you learn the techniques of the void. You gain the following abilities:

entries.name: Suffocate
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one ki point to attempt to knock the air from its body. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it has the air knocked from its body, begins suffocating, and can't breathe until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Vacuum Pull
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one ki point to create a vacuum centered on the target. Each creature other than you within 10 feet of the target must make a Strength saving throw or be pulled 5 feet toward the target and take bludgeoning damage equal to your Martial Arts die.

entries.name: Deflect Spell
entries: When you take damage from a spell, you can expend one ki point and use your reaction to reduce or nullify the magic. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10} + your Wisdom modifier + your monk level.

subclassFeature.name: Empty Soul
entries: At 6th level, you learn to fight without being weighed down by your own life energy. When you have no ki remaining, your movement speed increases by 10 feet and you gain temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) at the start of each of your turns.

subclassFeature.name: Empty Mind
entries: At 11th level, you learn to remove your presence. You are always under the effects of a {@spell nondetection} spell. Additionally, you are immune to psychic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Nothing
entries: At 17th level, you can become so empty that not even magic can exist around you. You can use your action to spend 6 ki points to cast {@spell antimagic field}, without material components.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the North Star
entries: Knights who swear an oath to the north star aid and guide travelers along their way. They take after the star itself, reliable and steadfast in even the darkest of times.

entries.name: Tenets of the North Star
entries: A paladin who takes this oath swears on a star in the sky on a clear night.

entries.name: Show the Way
entries: It is your duty to guide the lost back onto the righteous path. Otherwise, those who are lost will never find their way.

entries.name: Stand Strong
entries: Do not waver or break formation. Many rely on you, and for them you must stand strong.

entries.name: Shine in the Night
entries: Without the light above, the night would be dark. Shine bright and defend against the darkness.

entries.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of the Grave Spells
rows: {@spell aura of purity}, {@spell guradian of faith}

entries.name: Channel Divinity: Soothing Light
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to call out to your allies, reassuring and bolstering them. As a bonus action, choose a number of creatures up to your Charisma modifier (minimum one creature) within 60 feet of you that can see or hear you. Each target gains a number of temporary hit points equal to your paladin level and is immediately freed from the {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed} conditions.

entries.name: Channel Divinity: Stellar Glow
entries: As a bonus action, you can use your Channel Divinity to surround yourself in stardust. You emit dim light in a 5-foot radius for one minute. Attacks made at creatures within this dim light (including you) are at advantage. You can end this effect as a bonus action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Stardust
entries: Starting at 7th level, you emit an aura of starlight around you while you're not {@condition incapacitated}, casting dim light in a 10-foot radius around you. You can activate or suppress this aura as a bonus action.

When an {@condition invisible} creature moves within 10 feet of you for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed a Dexterity saving throw against your paladin spell save DC or become coated in tiny motes of stardust. While coated in this way, the affected creature can't benefit from being {@condition invisible}. These motes of stardust disappear once the affected creature moves out of the range of your aura.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Polaris
entries: At 15th level, you are an immovable bastion on the battlefield. While you are conscious, you cannot be pushed or moved involuntarily. Additionally, you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws against being knocked {@condition prone}.

subclassFeature.name: Supernova
entries: At 20th level, you gain the ability become the realization of the end of a star's life. As an action, you can magically infuse yourself with starlight, gaining the following benefits for 1 minutes:

items: You emit bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional 60 feet.
Your weapon attacks deal an additional {@damage 3d8} radiant damage on a hit.
When you use your Divine Smite feature, double the number of dice rolled for the radiant damage.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Shooting Star
entries: Rangers of the Shooting Star conclave emulate the brilliant displays of astral bodies streaking across the sky. Their arrows strike with the intensity and variety of these extraterrestrial phenomenon.

entries.name: Star Motes
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn to conjure motes of starlight. As a bonus action, you can expend a spell slot to conjure motes of starlight that encircle you. You conjure three motes with a 1st-level spell slot, creating one additional mote for each spell level higher than 1st. You can have a number of motes equal to your ranger level. Any additional motes you create disappear. These motes last until they are used or until you finish a long rest.

If you have four or more motes remaining, they shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you have one to three motes remaining, they shed dim light in a 20-foot radius.

You can expend a mote to make a ranged spell attack that you can use with the {@action Attack} action. The attack has a range of 120 feet, and on a hit the target takes {@damage 2d6} radiant damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you.

entries.name: Shooting Star Technique
entries: At 3rd level, you learn the three Shooting Star techniques.

entries.name: Illuminate
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend a mote to imbue a piece of ammunition with starlight. The ammunition sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius until the end of your next turn, after which it returns to normal. When you hit a creature with this piece of ammunition, it takes an additional {@damage 1d6} radiant damage, sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius until the end of your next turn, and the next attack roll made against it before the end of your next turn has advantage.

entries.name: Scattered Sparks.
entries: As an action, you can expend a mote and launch it at a point within 120 feet of you. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a Dexterity saving throw against your ranger spell save DC. A creature takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This damage increases to {@damage 3d6} at 7th level, {@damage 4d6} at 11th level, and {@damage 5d6} at 15th level.

entries.name: Comet Shot
entries: When you miss a ranged weapon attack or ranged spell attack, you can expend a mote to use a bonus action to reroll the attack roll against a different target within 60 feet of the original target. On a hit, the attack deals an additional {@damage 1d6} radiant damage.

subclassFeature.name: Luminous Defense
entries: At 7th level, the power of the stars comes to your aid in times of need. When a creature moves within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to make a mote attack at the creature.

subclassFeature.name: Starlight Strike
entries: At 11th level, your attacks become infused with starlight. Whenever you hit a creature with a weapon attack, it takes an additional {@damage 1d6} radiant damage.

subclassFeature.name: Conjure Mote
entries: At 15th level, you learn to create starlight motes with your own powers. You can use an action while you have no motes to create one mote.

subclassFeature.name: Shooting Star
entries: Rangers of the Shooting Star conclave emulate the brilliant displays of astral bodies streaking across the sky. Their arrows strike with the intensity and variety of these extraterrestrial phenomenon.

entries.name: Star Motes
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn to conjure motes of starlight. As a bonus action, you can expend a spell slot to conjure motes of starlight that encircle you. You conjure three motes with a 1st-level spell slot, creating one additional mote for each spell level higher than 1st. You can have a number of motes equal to your ranger level. Any additional motes you create disappear. These motes last until they are used or until you finish a long rest.

If you have four or more motes remaining, they shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you have one to three motes remaining, they shed dim light in a 20-foot radius.

You can expend a mote to make a ranged spell attack that you can use with the {@action Attack} action. The attack has a range of 120 feet, and on a hit the target takes {@damage 2d6} radiant damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you.

entries.name: Shooting Star Technique
entries: At 3rd level, you learn the three Shooting Star techniques. Some of your techniques require your target to make a saving throw to resist the feature's effects. The saving throw DC is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Illuminate
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend a mote to imbue a piece of ammunition with starlight. The ammunition sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius until the end of your next turn, after which it returns to normal. When you hit a creature with this piece of ammunition, it takes an additional {@damage 1d6} radiant damage, sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius until the end of your next turn, and the next attack roll made against it before the end of your next turn has advantage.

entries.name: Scattered Sparks.
entries: You can expend a mote and launch it at a point within 120 feet of you. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This damage increases to {@damage 3d6} at 7th level, {@damage 4d6} at 11th level, and {@damage 5d6} at 15th level.

entries.name: Comet Shot
entries: When you miss a ranged weapon attack or ranged spell attack, you can expend a mote to use a bonus action to reroll the attack roll against a different target within 60 feet of the original target. On a hit, the attack deals an additional {@damage 1d6} radiant damage.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Luminous Defense
entries: At 7th level, the power of the stars comes to your aid in times of need. When a creature moves within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to make a mote attack at the creature.

subclassFeature.name: Starlight Strike
entries: At 11th level, your attacks become infused with starlight. Whenever you hit a creature with a weapon attack, it takes an additional {@damage 1d6} radiant damage.

subclassFeature.name: Conjure Mote
entries: At 15th level, you learn to create starlight motes with your own powers. You can use an action while you have no motes to create one mote.

subclassFeature.name: Nightmare
entries: Rogues of the Nightmare archetype excel at combat in the dark, inflicting terror into their foes. These combatants prefer to operate at night or in places that otherwise never see the light of day, and are feared by the common folk. Nightmare rogues often scout out their targets' deepest fears, replicating them to great effect.

entries.name: Cover of Night
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn to mask your strikes with shadows. You don't need advantage on your attack roll to use your Sneak Attack if you attack while in dim light or darkness. All the other rules for the Sneak Attack class feature still apply to you.
Additionally, being in dim light or darkness does not have a negative effect on your passive Perception or passive Investigation.

entries.name: Afraid of the Dark
entries: At 3rd level, your blade strikes fear in the hearts of your foes. Whenever you deal damage with your Sneak Attack to a creature while you are in dim light or darkness, you can force it to make a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. The DC for this saving throw is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier. A creature is immune to this effect if it has darkvision.
If the creature loses sight of you, it instead becomes {@condition frightened} of all areas that are in complete darkness until it can see you again.
If the creature ends its turn in bright light, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Mask of Darkness
entries: At 9th level, the cover of night lends aid to your ability to deceive. You have advantage on Charisma (Deception) and Charisma (Intimidation) checks made while in dim light or darkness.

subclassFeature.name: Instill Dread
entries: At 13th level, you gain the ability to strike fear in your foes without lifting your blade. As a bonus action, you can speak words of terror and force a creature within 60 feet of you that can't see you to make a Wisdom saving throw against your Afraid of the Dark save DC. The target must be able to hear and understand you. If you are hidden, doing this does not give away your position. On a failed save, the target becomes {@condition frightened} of all areas that are heavily obscured from it for 1 minute, or until it sees you.
The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Strike Fear
entries: At 17th level, your blade cuts into the mind of your terrified foes. Whenever you hit a creature that is {@condition frightened} of you with an attack, the creature takes an extra {@damage 2d6} psychic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Star Spawn
entries: Star Spawn sorcerers inherit their magic from the mysterious creatures of the same name from the far reaches. Their magic is one of spatial manipulation and psychic energies, allowing them to move and cast spells in unpredictable and disruptive ways. The birth of a Star Spawn sorcerer occurs in the wake of a comet passing overhead, and forebodes the arrival of Elder Evils.

subclassFeature.name: Out of Phase
entries: Starting at 1st level, you gain the ability to move through material space. You can use a bonus action on your turn to become partially ethereal. Until the end of your turn, you can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. Each creature you move through takes {@damage 1d10} psychic damage; no creature can take this damage more than once per turn. You take {@damage 1d10} psychic damage if you end your turn inside an object and you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space that you can occupy.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Bend Space
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to collapse distance. As an action, you can spend one sorcery point to force a creature you can see within 30 feet of you to be forcefully warped. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your sorcerer spell save DC. On a failed save, the target, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, is magically teleported up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. A willing creature can choose to fail this save.
Additionally, as a reaction to being hit by an attack, you can spend one sorcery point to negate the damage and magically teleport yourself to an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Mirror
entries: At 14th level, you gain the ability to shield your mind and redirect psychic energies to the creatures around you. You can't be targeted by any divination magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

Additionally, when you take psychic damage, you can use your reaction to spend one sorcery point to negate the damage, and each creature within 5 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your sorcerer spell save DC or take psychic damage equal to the damage negated.

subclassFeature.name: Torrent of Madness
entries: Beginning at 18th level, you can channel the madness of the Elder Evils, confounding and disorienting those around you. As an action, you can spend 5 sorcery points to exude an aura of madness to a distance of 60 feet. Each creature within this area must make a Wisdom saving throw against your sorcere spell save DC or go insane. While insane, it can't take actions, can't understand what other creatures say, can't read, and speak only in gibberish. You can choose a number of creatures equal to your Charisma modifier to automatically succeed the saving throw.
If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to you, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

subclassFeature.name: The Nebula
entries: Your patron is a cloud of interstellar gas, chaotic and raw. You have bound yourself to this primeval being, allowing you to bear the power of creation that is the nebula's nature.
The nebula is a chaotic force of creation, and its desire to spawn new things into being are imparted upon its warlocks.

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Nebula lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Variant: Alternative Spells
entries: For players who do not have access to Xanathar's Guide to Everything, the spells in the Expanded Spell List {@spell absorb elements|XGE}, {@spell dragon's breath|XGE}, and {@spell dust devil|XGE} can be replaced with {@spell color spray}, {@spell continual flame}, and {@spell flaming sphere} respectively.

subclassFeature.name: Shimmering Cloud
entries: At 1st level, the powers of the nebula come to your protection. When you cast a spell using a warlock spell slot, you can create a cloud of glowing stardust around you. The cloud sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius. The cloud has hit points equal to 5 times the level of the warlock spell slot expended. Whenever you take damage, the cloud shifts to protect you, taking the damage instead. The cloud lingers until it is reduced to 0 hit points, or until you take a short or long rest.
If you cast another spell using a warlock spell slot while the cloud has more than 0 hit points, the cloud's hit points become equal to 5 times the level of the warlock spell slot expended.

subclassFeature.name: Pact of the Chain Option
entries: At 3rd level, a warlock gains the Pact Boon feature. The {@creature satellite|ATLAS} is an additional familiar option available to warlocks of the The Nebula patron who select the Pact of the Chain.

subclassFeature.name: Stardust Magic
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to bring objects into creation using stardust. You can expend hit points from your cloud to cast a warlock spell you know at its lowest level without expending a spell slot. The number of hit points expended equals 10 times the spell's level.

Additionally, while your Shimmering Cloud has more than 0 hit points, you can expend 1 hit point from the cloud as a bonus action to coalesce stardust and create an inanimate object in your hand or on the ground in an unoccupied space within the cloud. This object can be no larger than 3 feet on a side and weigh no more than 10 pounds, and its form must be that of a nonmagical object that you have seen. The object is visibly magical, radiating dim light out to 5 feet, and vanishes after 1 hour.

subclassFeature.name: Gaseous Evasion
entries: At 10th level, you learn to dissipate and reform your body in order to avoid harm. When you are hit with an attack from an attacker you can see, you can use your reaction to become amorphous gas and negate the damage. Until the start of your next turn, you remain as gas and have resistance to all damage.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Star Formation
entries: At 14th level, you learn to materialize your patron's powers in the creation of a new star. Choose a point within 60 feet you can see. A miniature star bursts into existence at the chosen point. Each creature within 30 feet of the star when it first appears must make a Constitution saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes 6d10 radiant damage and is blinded for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded. At the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

The star shines for one minute, and provides bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Creatures within 30 feet of the star have disadvantage on saving throws against your warlock spells.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: School of Astronomy
entries: The observation of the stars and celestial bodies of the greater universe is known as astronomy, with wizards who practice this tradition being known as astronomers. They study the different properties of the stars, and learn to create their own miniature celestial bodies.

entries.name: Astrological Augury
entries: When you choose this tradition, at 2nd level, you can study the stars to gain knowledge on a variety of subjects.

When you finish a long rest, you choose one skill of your choice from any of the following: Arcana, History, Religion, or Nature. You gain proficiency with that skill, or if you already have proficiency in the skill, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with that skill, until the end of your next long rest.

entries.name: Spell Stars
entries: Also, at 2nd level, you can conjure forth stars when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher. When you do so, you choose an unoccupied space within range of the spell, and a spell star appears at the point for 1 minute. The spell star provides bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. You can have a number of spell stars at once equal to half your wizard level. While you are within 60 feet of a spell star, you can cast spells as though you were in the spell star's space.

Additionally, you can use your bonus action to cause any number of spell stars within 60 feet of yourself explode. Each creature within 5 feet of a spell star must make on a Dexterity saving throw against your wizard spell save DC or take {@damage 2d6} radiant damage. A creature in the area of more than one spell star burst is affected only once.

subclassFeature.name: Realign
entries: At 6th level, you learn to shift your stars as you desire. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move a spell star within 60 feet of you up to 30 feet in any direction. If you ram the spell star into a creature, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw against your wizard spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} radiant damage and the spell star disappears.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Constellation
entries: Starting at 10th level, you can channel magic between your stars as if they were portals. When you cast a spell with an area of effect that includes one of your spell stars, you can choose another spell star within 60 feet of you to carry the effect. Each creature within 10 feet of the chosen spell star is also affected by your spell.

subclassFeature.name: Constellate
entries: At 14th level, you can channel your arcane energy to create a constellation in an instant. As an action, you can expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher to create a number of spell stars equal to the slot level, placing each star at a point you can see within 60 feet of you.
